For consistency with stats::simulate(), the simulate method for a fable model should accept these arguments: object: The model itself nsim: The number of simulated series (note: this differs from forecastâ€™s usage which is the length of the series) seed: Random generator initialisation Additionally, it is recommended that model simulations for fable also accept a tsibble containing new_data. This dataset extends existing simulate functionality by allowing the simulation to accept a new time index for simulating beyond the sample (.idx), a set of pre-generated innovations (.innov), and a new set of exogenous regressors (say x1 and x2).
